== Testing Bluetooth ==

=== Making a note of the device ===
# On the phone drag down the bluetooth indicator
# Tap on settings
# Scan for the device you want to test
# Connect the DUT(Device Under Test, Phone or tablet) to an ubuntu pc
# On the pc open the terminal and type <code>adb shell</code>
# In the shell type <code>bluetoothctl</code> on the whole this will display the mac address and name of the device
# Copy the mac address
# In the bluetoothctl shell type <code>info</code> then paste the mac address and hit enter
# Copy the description into a text file and keep it safe incase you need to report a bug.

=== Install Pilot ===
# Goto the apps scopes
# Tap on search
# Type in pilot
# Tap on the store icon
# Tap on pilot
# Tap on install, add you ubuntuone login details if required
# Pilot is now installed

=== Run the tests ===
# Open pilot
# Run through the test suite passing, skipping or failing where required

=== Passes ===
Woohoo everything is awesome

=== Skipping ===
Please only use this option if you physically have no access to a device as we would like to cover as many different devices as possible, many thanks

=== Failing ===
Please file bugs for tests that fail it is important to us that we get any issues resolved.<<BR>>
When filing bugs it is important to include the following information:
# The devices you are using (the information you stored in the text file from above) and the phone/tablet you are using
# The point at which it broke
# Be aware that you may be asked from more info this can include debugging info which can be found <nowiki>[[https://wiki.ubuntu.com/DebuggingBluetooth|Here]]</nowiki>
